{
  "concepts": [
    {"term": "magnetic moment", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "precess", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "magnetic field", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "energy state", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "net magnetization vector", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "MRI", "category": "modality"},
    {"term": "magnetization", "category": "physics"}
  ],
  "evidence": [
    "Each proton carries a magnetic moment",
    "these moments precess around the external magnetic field",
    "aligned parallel to the magnetic field",
    "slightly more occupy the lower-energy state",
    "net magnetization vector",
    "We can treat it as a classical vector that can tilt, rotate, or precess",
    "So, magnetization is the bridge from the microscopic quantum world of spins to the macroscopic signals we use in MRI"
  ]
}

evidence: Each proton carries a magnetic moment
these moments precess around the external magnetic field
aligned parallel to the magnetic field
slightly more occupy the lower-energy state
We can treat it as a classical vector that can tilt, rotate, or precess
So, magnetization is the bridge from the microscopic quantum world of spins to the macroscopic signals we use in MRI
